intro: Impatiens lobulifera, commonly known as the lobed impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, with heart-shaped leaves that are often lobed, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
